meanings.definition: To remove the influence or practices of Nazism from (a person, organization, or society).
meanings.sent1: The school denazified its curriculum to ensure no Nazi ideas were taught.
meanings.sent2: After the war, many countries denazified to promote peace and unity.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show denazified a villain character by giving them a silly hat instead of a swastika.
meanings.sent4: Her speech denazified the room, washing away any remnants of hatred.
meanings.sent5: The denazified town felt like a fresh start, free from the shadows of the past.

meanings.definition: To make free from Nazi ideology or influence.
meanings.sent1: The documentary denazified the minds of its viewers, showing the horrors of the regime.
meanings.sent2: The denazified books in the library helped educate future generations about the dangers of extremism.
meanings.sent3: The art exhibition denazified the paintings by covering up any Nazi symbols with flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her words denazified his beliefs, opening his eyes to a world beyond hate.
meanings.sent5: The denazified community stood strong against any attempts to revive fascist ideals.
